revised_title: Preliminary Account of the Total Eclipse of the Sun, May 28, 1900, and Observations by the Solar Physics Observatory Eclipse Expedition
tldr: The author describes the preparations and observations made by the Solar Physics Observatory Eclipse Expedition during the total eclipse of the Sun on May 28, 1900. The expedition, led by Sir Norman Lockyer, used various instruments and a team of observers to study the solar corona and other phenomena.
